content: * *Rural West Constituency** was a [constituency](/wiki/Constituencies_of_Singapore) represented in the [Legislative Council of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Council_of_Singapore) from 1948 until 1951. It elected one Legislative Council member. The constituency was formed in 1948 and cover the areas of Bajau, [Bukit Batok](/wiki/Bukit_Batok), [Bukit Panjang](/wiki/Bukit_Panjang), [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah), [Choa Chu Kang](/wiki/Choa_Chu_Kang), [Clementi](/wiki/Clementi,_Singapore), [Jurong](/wiki/Jurong), [Kranji](/wiki/Kranji), [Lim Chu Kang](/wiki/Lim_Chu_Kang), [Mandai](/wiki/Mandai), Pandan, [Pasir Panjang](/wiki/Pasir_Panjang), Peng Kang, [Seletar](/wiki/Seletar), [Sembawang](/wiki/Sembawang), [Tuas](/wiki/Tuas), Ulu Kalang, Ulu Pandan, [Woodlands](/wiki/Woodlands,_Singapore), [Yishun](/wiki/Yishun). In 1951, the constituency was abolished and split into [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah_Constituency) and [Seletar constituencies](/wiki/Seletar_Constituency). ## Legislative Council member YearMemberParty(/wiki/1948_Singaporean_general_election)[Srish Chandra Goho](/wiki/Srish_Chandra_Goho)[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)1948Balwant Singh Bajaj[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1940s [General Election 1948](/wiki/1948_Singaporean_general_election): Rural West PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)****[Srish Chandra Goho](/wiki/Srish_Chandra_Goho)** **981** **50.0** [Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)Malathi Pillai52026.5[PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))[Arumugam Ponnu Rajah](/wiki/A._P._Rajah)46023.5[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)46123.5[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)2,03673.4[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)2,774[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician) **win**[By-election 1948](/wiki/1948_Rural_West_by-election) PartyCandidateVotes%±%**[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)****Balwant Singh Bajaj** **1,638** **55.5** [PP](/wiki/Progressive_Party_(Singapore))Cheong Hock Chye70523.9 0.4[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician)[Maganlal Gangaram](/wiki/Maganlal_Gangaram)60620.5[Majority](/wiki/Majority#Related_terms)93331.6[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)3,12172.9 0.5[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)4,279[Independent](/wiki/Independent_politician) **win** This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
